stanza.sent: Suddenly, I stopped thinking about Love, after so many years of only that, after thinking that nothing else mattered.
And what was I thinking of when I stopped thinking about Love?
Death, of course-what else could take Love's place?
What else could hold such force?
I thought about how far away Death once had seemed, how unexpected that it could happen to someone I knew quite well,
how impossible that this should be the normal thing, as natural as frost and winter.
I thought about the way we'd aged,
how skin fell into wrinkles, how eyes grew dim; then (of course) my love, I thought of you.
